item.title: Resident Evil Requiem Leakers ‚ÄòDeserve A Thousand Deaths‚Äô, Says Ex-Capcom Director
item.content:encoded:
Iconic Capcom, PlatinumGames, and now Clovers dev Hideki Kamiya has commented on Resident Evil Requiem‚Äôs leaks, which arose after the game‚Äôs physical street date was broken by well over a week.

Resident Evil Requiem is 2026‚Äôs first major AAA game. Capcom‚Äòs franchise returns to a decimated Raccoon City. The hype has been huge, and the expectations are bigger than a skyscraper made entirely of El Gigantes. Unfortunately, countless buyers were able to get their hands on the game early, and it began a huge wave of Requiem spoilers.

Hideki Kamiya Not Happy With Resident Evil Requiem Spoilers

It‚Äôs not uncommon for a game‚Äôs physical street date to be broken, resulting in copies of the game being distributed days before launch, but Resident Evil Requiem went out roughly 10 days or more before launch. Leaks were inevitable, and social media was flooded with story spoilers and much more very quickly.

  • More Insider Gaming: Resident Evil Requiem Release Date & Start Times

Hideki Kamiya has shared his thoughts on the leaks and used a previous experience to summarize his thoughts. Here‚Äôs what he said, according to Google Translate:

‚ÄúI remember back with Bio2, the late-game plot twist got totally scooped by some photo weekly mag, right‚Ä¶ For your own selfish satisfaction, you‚Äôre trampling all over the feelings of users who were looking forward to it, and the feelings of the creators who poured their all into making it‚Äîa detestable act that destroys everyone‚Äôs happiness and deserves a thousand deaths‚Ä¶ May you be cursed to never play games again‚Ä¶

Kamiya directed Resident Evil 2, the first Devil May Cry, and Bayonetta, and has attached his talents to many other projects. Needless to say, he‚Äôs not someone you should want to disrespect.

Are you one of the many who have been fortunate enough to get the game early? Does the internet need filters to prevent this sort of content from being so easily discoverable? Let us know through the Insider Gaming Discord Server.

As a free-to-play, accessible New York Times game, NYT Connections is available worldwide and can be played on desktop devices or in a mobile app.

But how do you play NYT Connections?

The NYT team will provide you with a grid of 16 words once a day. The only task left up to you is to sort those words into four groups of four by finding their commonalities. item.title: Assassin‚Äôs Creed Franchise Announces New Leadership
item.content:encoded:
A new leadership team has been announced for the Assassin‚Äôs Creed franchise, including a head of brand, a head of content, and a head of production excellence.

Since the announcement of Ubisoft‚Äôs restructuring and the future of the Assassin‚Äôs Creed franchise, fans have been waiting for more clarity on the way forward. We have recently discovered that two Far Cry games and several Assassin‚Äôs Creed titles are currently in development. Additionally, we have been informed about the leadership behind these projects.

Assassin‚Äôs Creed Franchise Gets New Trio As Leadership

Announced through a new post on X (formerly Twitter), three seasoned leaders have been revealed to carry forward the Assassin‚Äôs Creed Franchise. They will be responsible for driving the Assassin‚Äôs Creed brand‚Äôs long-term vision, creative ambition, and continued growth.

Martin Schelling will take on the role of Head of the Assassin‚Äôs Creed Brand and will focus on the ‚Äúoverall strategy and long-term vision of the brand.‚Äù Schelling has a ‚Äúprofound understanding of Assassin‚Äôs Creed‚Äù thanks to being a part of leadership in games like Revelations, Black Flag, Origins, and Valhalla. Most recently, he served as Ubisoft‚Äôs Chief Production Officer.

Then we have Jean Guesdon, who will serve as Head of Content for the Assassin‚Äôs Creed franchise and will be responsible for leading overall creative direction, supporting individual games, and guiding the future. Guesdon has been the creative director for both Origins and Black Flag.

Last but not least is Fran√ßois de Billy, who has been named as the Head of Production Excellence in Assassin‚Äôs Creed‚Äôs new leadership. Fran√ßois de Billy will be responsible for strengthening production practices and execution across the brand. He was previously the Production Director on Valhalla and Origins.

The trio will be joining the rest of the Assassin‚Äôs Creed leadership team in the coming weeks, including Andr√©e-Anne Boisvert, Producer for Assassin‚Äôs Creed‚Äôs cross-brand initiatives and Head of Technological Excellence, and Lionel Hiller, VP Brand and Go-to-Market Strategy.

item.title: Does Windrose Have PvP?
item.content:encoded:
Considering how popular the concept of pirates is, it‚Äôs a surprise that there aren‚Äôt really that many successful pirate video games. Aside from the likes of Assassin‚Äôs Creed: Black Flag and Sea of Thieves, it‚Äôs slim pickings, but there appears to be a new kid on the block, going by the name Windrose.

It‚Äôs still in Early Access, but that hasn‚Äôt stopped the title from blowing up in popularity, and fans are eagerly jumping into the brand-new demo. However, although it‚Äôs multiplayer, there‚Äôs a lot of confusion surrounding whether Windrose will feature PvP combat, so Insider Gaming has done some sleuthing and struck gold, as the answer has been revealed.

Does Windrose Have PvP?

Despite the fact that Windrose has multiplayer features, there is no PvP enabled, as it is a strictly PvE adventure.

Windrose has been on a long, arduous development journey, and plenty of changes and course corrections have been made over the years. Originally, the game was titled Crosswind, and it was set to be an open-world pirate MMO full of Pirate PvE‚Äîand PvP.

  • More Insider Gaming: PC Gaming Show: Most Wanted

However, since then, the Windrose Crew has drastically altered its plans. Instead, Windrose will now be a survival-focused adventure title, chock full of PvE encounters on both land and sea, with PvP laid to the wayside.

Will Windrose Have PvP?

Unfortunately, it looks like that ship has sailed, as there seems to be no intention of bringing PvP combat to the high seas of Windrose.

That might be disappointing to some fans out there, as the concept of naval combat against other players is admittedly a thrilling one. However, the developers behind Windrose clearly felt that their ambitions better aligned with a PvE experience, and the game‚Äôs early success makes it seem like that might have been the right call.

  • More Insider Gaming: Does God Of War: Sons Of Sparta Have Multiplayer?

Plus, the concept of PvP would have been much better suited to the MMO genre, with large-scale battles on the cards. Now that the game has instead opted for a more focused experience, it appears that it was a good call for PvP to walk the plank.

Have you tried out Windrose? Do you wish it had PvP? Share your thoughts in the official Insider Gaming Discord Server.

item.title: PlayStation Plus March 2026 Free Monthly Games Headliner Revealed
item.content:encoded:
A reliable insider has revealed that PGA Tour 2K25 will headline PlayStation Plus free monthly games in March 2026.

The game catalog and free monthly games for February have arrived. Although Essential members didn‚Äôt receive anything special last month, Extra and Premium members were greeted with Marvel‚Äôs Spider-Man 2. Now, it seems Essential is also receiving a strong addition in 2K‚Äôs latest Golf video game.

PGA Tour 2K25 is Headlining PlayStation Plus March 2026 Monthly Games

As reported by reliable billbil-kun via Dealabs, PGA Tour 2K25 will headline PlayStation Plus monthly games (Essential) in March 2026. The game will be available from March 3, and players will have until April 7 to add the game to their library. PGA Tour 2K25 will be available for PS Plus tiers: Essential, Extra, and Premium/Deluxe. There is no news about the other titles, but PlayStation is expected to reveal them on February 25.

PGA Tour 2K25 was released for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, and PC a year ago and received a port for the Switch 2 just this month. The latest title in the series includes all the major tournaments for players to compete in, including The PGA Championship, The U.S. Open, and The Open Championship.

It also features the core 2K game modes, including MyCAREER, MyPLAYER, and more. You can play the game online or locally, battle it out with legends like Tiger Woods, dynamically simulate rounds, train for tournaments, climb the Ranked leaderboards, and much more.

In other news, PlayStation 5 was the best-selling hardware in the U.S. in January 2026. Additionally, Bluepoint Games is shutting down next month.
